reasoning: Multi-component UI feature requiring frontend (8-10 files) and backend API work. Uses existing MUI patterns, no new external dependencies. Moderate complexity from data visualization (workload bars) and calendar component, but well within standard scope.

scope.notes: Frontend: Main view, team overview, member cards, workload distribution, workload bars, weekly calendar, availability components, types, styles. Backend: API endpoints for team workload data.

integrations.notes: All components can be built with existing Material-UI library. No new external dependencies required. Workload bars and calendar can be custom-built with MUI primitives.

infrastructure.notes: Pure application code. May need to verify existing data models support workload/availability data, but no schema changes expected.

knowledge.notes: Codebase already uses React, TypeScript, MUI, dayjs. Standard component patterns apply. Workload visualization can use CSS gradients or MUI Box components.

concerns: Workload calculation logic needs clear definition
Data model for team availability needs verification
risk.notes: Primary risks are around data modeling and calculation accuracy. UI complexity is moderate but manageable with MUI.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Multi-component UI feature with data visualization and filtering requires unit tests for each component and integration tests for API interactions and filtering logic. No security concerns or infrastructure changes.
